lines.content: welcome to KaChinnnng a personal finance tracker that helps you keep track of your expenses and income.
1. Ensure that you have Java 11 or above installed.
2. Download the latest version of `KaChinnnng` from [here](http://link.to/duke).
3. Copy the downloaded file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for your KaChinnnng.
4. open a command terminal and navigate to the folder where you have copied the file to.
5. type in the following to run the program
6. if successful you should see the following output
Welcome to KaChinnnngggg! How may i assist you today?
7. type in desired commands and press enter to execute them. (note: commands are not case sensitive)
Shows basic commands executable by the program.
Creates a new entry for income or expenses in the program.
Values of income and expense added has to be lower than 1000000.
Income and Expense values takes up to 2 decimal places.
- Prompts users if any of the fields are empty.
- There are only 3 categories for expenses: `Food`, `Transport`, `Utilities`.
- Amount is takes up to 2 decimal places.
- by default, amount is set to SGD.
- Date needs to be an existing date, and cannot be dates in the future.
Shows a full list of both the expenses and income created by the user.
User can choose to view the list of income/expenses separately as well.
Deletes an entry from the list of income/expenses.
**Q**: How do I transfer my data to another computer?
* This class is the main class of the program.
* It contains the main method that runs the program.
* The `Balance` class represents a financial balance calculator
* that calculates the balance between income and expenses.
* It takes a list of income and expense records as input and provides methods to calculate and display the balance.
* Calculates the financial balance by subtracting the total expenses from the total income.
* Prints a message to the console displaying the calculated financial balance.
* Represents the abstract class for all commands.
* This class serves as a blueprint for all specific command classes in the application
* This method is used to execute the command.
* @throws KaChinnnngException if there is an error in the command
public void execute(ArrayList<Expense> expenses, String fullcommand, Ui ui) throws KaChinnnngException {
System.out.println("Noted. This expense record has been deleted:");

throw new KaChinnnngException("Oops! An integer index is expected");
throw new KaChinnnngException("Oops! Income " + index + " does not exist");

* Represents the parser for the Income class.

* This method is used to parse the date of the income.
* This method is used by the IncomeParser class in the application
* This method is used by the IncomeManager class in the application

* @throws KaChinnnngException if there is an error in the command
public static LocalDate parseDate(String incomeDateString) throws KaChinnnngException {
assert incomeDateString != null : "incomeDateString should not be null";
throw new KaChinnnngException("Please enter a valid date in the format dd/MM/yyyy");
LOGGER.log(Level.WARNING, "Date is in the future" + incomeDateString);
throw new KaChinnnngException("Please enter a date that is not in the future");

* This method prints the line divider.
* Prints the welcome message when the program starts.

* Prints the goodbye message when the program ends.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* prints the message when the user inputs his income
* @param income Income object created from the provided fields
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this income:\n" + income.toString());
* Prints a message indicating the start of the income list display.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this expense:\n" + expense.toString());
* This test class provides test cases to check the calculation and reporting
* of financial balance between income and expenses.
* Called before every test case method.
* Test the {@link Balance#getBalance()} method with both income and expenses.
* This test case checks if the balance calculation correctly subtracts expenses from income.
* Test the {@link Balance#getBalance()} method with no records.
* This test case checks if the balance calculation correctly returns 0.
Balance balance = new Balance(new ArrayList<>(), new ArrayList<>());
"Balance should be 0 when no records are present.");
* Test the {@link Balance#getBalance()} method with no expenses.
* This test case checks if the balance calculation correctly returns a positive value equal to income.
Balance balance = new Balance(incomesOnly, new ArrayList<>());
"Balance should equal sum of all incomes when no expenses are present.");
* Test the {@link Balance#getBalance()} method with no incomes.
* This test case checks if the balance calculation correctly returns a negative value equal to expenses.
Balance balance = new Balance(new ArrayList<>(), expensesOnly);
"Balance should be negative sum of all expenses when no incomes are present.");
* Test suite for the {@link Expense} class.
* This class contains unit tests to validate the behavior of the Expense class and ensure
* correctness in the representation and management of financial expenses.
* Initializes common test fixtures before each test execution.
